segments.text: Good afternoon . I'd like to speak with Tom Smith .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm afraid he's away from his desk at the moment .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you know when he will be back ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: He's away on a business trip . He won't be back until some time next week .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is there some way I can get into contact with him ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The best way to reach him is by cell phone . I'll give you his number .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Thanks . And could I have his e-mail , just in case I can't get him by phone ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure . His cell phone is 09112223 33 . And his e-mail is lower case t , smith--that's one word , at , c , c , w , dot , com , dot , t , w .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Thank you so much . Does he read his e-mails daily ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Great . Thanks again . You've been very helpful .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My pleasure . I hope you get a hold of him .
segments.speaker: S2
